description: Comprehensive pre-calculus course covering algebraic foundations, functions, polynomials, rational, exponential and logarithmic functions, systems, matrices, trigonometry, analytic trigonometry, conic sections, parametric/polar equations, sequences, series, counting, and an introduction to calculus. Designed to prepare students for AP Calculus and advanced math courses.

topics.name: Unit 1: Algebraic Fundamentals
topics.description: Expressions, equations, inequalities, factoring, exponents, radicals, and algebraic manipulation.

topics.name: Unit 2: Functions and Their Properties
topics.description: Domain, range, function notation, composition, inverse functions, and transformations.

topics.name: Unit 3: Polynomial Functions
topics.description: Polynomial behavior, degree, leading coefficients, zeros, factoring, and graphing.

topics.name: Unit 4: Rational Functions
topics.description: Asymptotes, discontinuities, graphing rational functions, and solving rational equations.

topics.name: Unit 5: Exponential and Logarithmic Functions
topics.description: Exponential growth and decay, logarithm properties, solving equations, and applications.

topics.name: Unit 6: Systems and Matrices
topics.description: Solving systems of equations, matrix operations, determinants, and applications.

topics.name: Unit 7: Trigonometry - Angles and the Unit Circle
topics.description: Angle measure, unit circle, reference angles, radians, degrees, and basic trig ratios.

topics.name: Unit 8: Graphs of Trig Functions
topics.description: Graphing sine, cosine, tangent, cotangent, secant, cosecant functions and amplitude, period, phase shifts.

topics.name: Unit 9: Analytic Trig I - Identities
topics.description: Pythagorean, reciprocal, quotient, cofunction, sum/difference, double-angle, and half-angle identities.

topics.name: Unit 10: Analytic Trig II - Equations
topics.description: Solving trigonometric equations using identities, factoring, and algebraic techniques.

topics.name: Unit 11: Applications of Trig
topics.description: Solving real-world problems including law of sines, law of cosines, bearings, and periodic phenomena.

topics.name: Unit 12: Conic Sections
topics.description: Circles, ellipses, parabolas, hyperbolas, standard equations, and graphing techniques.

topics.name: Unit 13: Parametric and Polar Equations
topics.description: Parametric equations, graphing, polar coordinates, polar graphs, and conversions between forms.

topics.name: Unit 14: Sequences, Series, and Counting
topics.description: Arithmetic and geometric sequences, series formulas, sigma notation, counting principles, and combinatorics.

topics.name: Unit 15: Introduction to Calculus
topics.description: Concepts of limits, continuity, derivatives, and introductory differential calculus applications.
